This video is bs, the principle and science is correct however, if you see Marilyn at a 'normal' screen viewing distance then you must be quite short sighted (> -2.50 or so) and with that level of short sightedness you would notice without this video (struggling seeing the tv etc.). Anyone watching on a phone would need to be very short sighted (> -4.50 or so) to see Marilyn because even if you need glasses for short sightedness, the image is would still be in focus as it is not far enough away. Also, anyone under the ago of 40 who is long sighted would see Einstein at a 'regular' viewing distance. So basically nearly everyone will appear to have "good" eyes even if they do need glasses

Well there's an issue with you doing this "test" in a video. A monitor can only display so many pixels at once. Pixels define resolution and resolution is how clearly somebody can see an image. Couple this with the fact that YouTube can't always provide the best resolution for a video and you have a pretty severe impact on the performance of the "test".

Either way, it's an interesting thing. Nice video. :)
